SENT.plain: Valvular involvement is common in antiphospholipid syndrome (APS) with increased risk of thrombo-embolic events
We report a patient with APS and multiple cerebral infarcts
Echocardiography demonstrated verrucous vegetations of the mitral valve in keeping with marantic endocarditis
The patient underwent successful mitral valve replacement
Post-operative clinical and echocardiographic follow-up showed excellent short term results
